description: The agent has lost communications with a managed device.

event.Summary: Communication lost with a managed device

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: The firmware update to the agent card has completed successfully.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: The firmware update to the agent card has failed and the firmware is
now corrupt.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: The agent card is alive.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: The present number of conditions (rows) in the lgpConditionsTable.
variables.name: LIEBERT-GP-CONDITIONS-MIB::lgpConditionsPresent

description: The number of devices currently connected and communicating
successfully with the agent. Devices for which communications are
currently being attempted are not considered in this count.
variables.name: LIEBERT-GP-AGENT-MIB::lgpAgentConnectedDeviceCount

description: A Domain Name System (DNS) lookup of a network name failed to
resolve. This may result in one or more of the following:
1. failure to notify a target address of an important condition
2. failure allow access for monitoring purposes
This issue should be resolved as soon as possible with a
network or system administrator.

event.Summary: DNS lookup for $v2 failed to resolve

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: The network name in a node.domain.com like format. This object is
intended to be used as a varbind object by other notifications that
have a context of a network address. As an example the
lgpAgentDnsLookupFailure trap which describes a network name that
is failing or has failed to be resolved from a Domain Name Service (DNS)
lookup.
Refer to RFC 952 for further information.
variables.name: LIEBERT-GP-CONDITIONS-MIB::lgpNetworkName
